questions.question_text: Which of the following is MOST important for an IS auditor to do during an exit meeting with an auditee?

choices.C: Communicate the recommendations to senior management.
choices.B: Ensure that the facts presented in the report are correct.
choices.D: Request input in determining corrective action.
choices.A: Specify implementation dates for the recommendations.

discussion.content: B seems correct: The exit interview, conducted at the end of the audit, provides an IS auditor with the opportunity to discuss findings and recommendations with the auditee management. During the exit interview, an IS auditor should: • Ensure that the facts presented in the report are correct and material. • Ensure that the recommendations are realistic and cost-effective and, if not, seek alternatives through negotiation with auditee management. • Recommend implementation dates for agreed-on recommendations.

Selected Answer: B
The primary objective of an exit meeting with an auditee is to confirm that the findings and facts presented in the audit report are accurate. This ensures that there are no misunderstandings or factual errors that could undermine the credibility of the report. By aligning on the facts, the auditor facilitates constructive dialogue about the findings and establishes a foundation for any subsequent recommendations or corrective actions.

Selected Answer: B
During an exit meeting ensure that the facts presented in the report are correct. After the closing meeting you communicate the recommendations to senior management.
B is right answer

Selected Answer: C
Out of the given options, the most important task for an IS auditor during an exit meeting with an auditee is to communicate the recommendations to senior management (option C). This is because the purpose of an audit is to identify areas where improvements can be made and to provide recommendations on how to address any identified weaknesses or deficiencies. These recommendations are typically addressed to senior management, who are responsible for implementing the necessary changes.

Selected Answer: C

questions.question_text: Which of the following should be the PRIMARY role of an internal audit function in the management of identified business risks?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
While operating the risk management framework (Option C) is an important responsibility, it is typically the responsibility of management and the risk management function within the organization. Internal audit's role is to provide independent assurance and validation of the effectiveness of these processes, rather than directly operating them.

Selected Answer: A
The PRIMARY role of an internal audit function in the management of identified business risks is to validate enterprise risk management (ERM). Internal audit validates the effectiveness of the organization's risk management processes, including the identification, assessment, and mitigation of risks.
C. Operating the risk management framework

questions.question_text: Which of the following is MOST critical for the effective implementation of IT governance?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
While all the options are important for the effective implementation of IT governance, a supportive corporate culture is most critical because it reflects the attitudes, values, goals, and practices shared by the organization. This directly influences the effectiveness of IT governance. No matter how great your rules, policies, or risk management practices are, if your culture does not support governance practices or see their value, they likely will not be followed or taken seriously. A supportive corporate culture ensures compliance and also promotes an environment where IT governance can evolve and improve, ensuring its effectiveness and success.

Selected Answer: A
all of the options listed are important for the effective implementation of IT governance. However, a supportive corporate culture is the most critical, as it provides the foundation for effective IT governance practices and helps to ensure that IT-related decisions are made in the best interests of the organization.

Selected Answer: C
It should be C
A. Supportive corporate culture

choices.C: Computer operations personnel initiate batch processing jobs daily.
choices.D: Financial data in key reports is traced to source systems for completeness and accuracy.
choices.B: Network user accounts for temporary workers expire after 90 days.
choices.A: Application user access is reviewed every 180 days for appropriateness.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
This control is relatively easy to implement because it leverages the system's user account management capabilities to automatically manage the accounts. In contrast, a control that tracks the completeness and accuracy of financial data (D) can be difficult to implement through system configuration alone because it involves more processes and manual intervention.

questions.question_text: Which of the following controls is BEST implemented through system configuration?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is the correct answer over D because testing with actual data verifies whether the application's controls function as intended in real execution, whereas code review only analyzes the logic without confirming its practical effectiveness.

Selected Answer: C
Using test data is the most appropriate technique for verifying application program controls because it allows an IS auditor to simulate various input scenarios and evaluate how the application processes the data. This technique helps to verify whether controls, such as validation, authorization, and processing logic, are functioning as intended.

Test data can include both valid and invalid inputs to check how the system handles different cases, ensuring the application enforces controls correctly.

Selected Answer: C
it allows the IS auditor to simulate real-world scenarios and evaluate how the application processes data under various conditions. This method helps determine whether the controls embedded in the application are functioning as intended.

Selected Answer: D
Code review involves examining the source code of an application to identify errors, vulnerabilities, and deviations from coding standards. This process allows for a thorough assessment of the implementation of application program controls within the code itself. By reviewing the code, auditors can evaluate the logic and functionality of the controls, ensuring they are correctly implemented to achieve the desired security, integrity, and reliability objectives.

While the use of test data (Option C) is also an important technique for testing and validating application program controls, it primarily focuses on assessing the functionality and performance of the application, rather than directly verifying the implementation of controls within the code.

Selected Answer: C
Using test data is the most appropriate technique for verifying application program controls. This method involves inputting mock data into the system and subsequently analyzing the output. This allows examination of how the system processes data and enables the verification of system behavior against expected results. It is especially beneficial in testing application program controls as it can help identify any weaknesses or errors in the system's processing controls. Other techniques such as observation of data entry, statistical sampling, and code review does not directly validate the processing controls within the application.
I'm going with C. Using test data. Non-operational, non-impact, and can see the test results. I'm not sure that auditors are SME's at reviewing code, enough to look for defects.

https://owasp.org/www-pdf-archive/OWASP_Code_Review_Guide_v2.pdf 

What is Secure Code Review? Code review aims to identify security flaws in the application related to its features and design, along with the exact root causes. With the increasing complexity of applications and the advent of new technologies, the traditional way of testing may fail to detect all the security flaws present in the applications. One must understand the code of the application, external components, and configurations to have a better chance of finding the flaws. Such a deep dive into the application code also helps in determining exact mitigation techniques that can be used to avert the security flaws.

It is the process of auditing the source code of an application to verify that the proper security and logical controls are present, that they work as intended, and that they have been invoked in the right places. Code review is a way of helping ensure that the application has been developed so as to be “self-defending” in its given environment.

Selected Answer: D
